alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 28 at 4:22PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Extensive flooding of major roadways is expected. Rapid rises on creeks and rivers anticipated. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Brevard, Lake, Orange, Osceola, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to rainbands from Hurricane Ian. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Melbourne, Kissimmee, Titusville, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Saint Cloud, Winter Park, Casselberry, Rockledge, Cocoa, Maitland, Cocoa Beach, Satellite Beach, Cape Canaveral and Wedgefield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
